website_summaries.verdict: A more long-term radon home test kit to measure gas levels in a reliable manner.
pros: The test is designed to work without altering day-to-day home use
Can be placed out of the way as the charcoal absorbs the surrounding radon
cons: Can produce inaccurate results if used in high humidity or damp climates and homes

customer_reviews.title: Easy test and quick turn around!
customer_reviews.text: This radon test includes shipping to the lab, via normal mail, which I like. The turnaround time was within a week of sending it to them. The competitor's radon test turnaround is just over a week from when they receive the test if there's not a rush and shipping isn't included (an extra $3.50). This test takes an extra day to complete in the home, 3 days instead of 2, but that was no biggy for me. The result seemed reliable. If you have to do a few radon tests, this is the way to go to not break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: nelhig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent charcoal radon test kit.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate--compared results to electronic monitor. Test results sent back promptly. Would be excellent for winter and summer "spot checks". Was rated highly by Consumer Reports.
customer_reviews.author: Ed S

customer_reviews.title: No results
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 12/04/2018, followed directions and mailed it off. Haven't heard anything in over 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this company
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions which were understandable. When the test time was over, I used the prepaid mailer to send the test to AirCheck, radon.com. I mailed the test at the main US Post Office. AirCheck claims that it took 13 days to receive the test, and, therefore, it was no longer valid. I doubt that the US Postal System took that long to transport the test kit. The test results from AirCheck were delivered to me in only 6 days, via USPS. THIS TEST WAS A TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: It works well and too many radon air check test ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well and too many radon air check test that you have to pay for this one has no extra lab fee...
customer_reviews.author: Mandi 000

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time and money with this company.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on these bozos! They sit on the test until it is too late. They offer to replace the test, but what good is that if you never get reliable results. I also purchased a competitor product and had the results 4 days after mailing it in.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Porter

customer_reviews.title: Easy, accurate, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to use. It seems to be accurate, when compared to my Airthings $200 device. I did make one mistake that resulted in the test's not being as accurate as it could have been: I sent it by regular mail. I advise everyone who wants a more precise result to notice that the directions say to return it by FedEx, UPS Express, USPS Express, or USPS Priority mail.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Rucker

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have used these as I decided to start testing more frequently as their are high levels of radon in my area. Luckily mine have always come back fine but I will continue to test every year to be safe. Very easy to use and only took about a week to get results.
customer_reviews.author: trynabehealthy

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy two kits. First kit was totally too high for my brand new house test. Bought a second one and after taking more than 2 weeks to provide another high level, they sent me a free retake. Those results proved also high. Had to call in a professional to provide an accurate reading.
customer_reviews.author: drosen9

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for screening test
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for screening test. Easy to use, and lab results were available in about a week after sending it in.
customer_reviews.author: JJPEngr

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t have such a good experience
customer_reviews.text: I set up the radon test, as directed. I sent the radon test in, as directed. I received an email stating the corner of one side of the test was damaged so the test could not be read. So either the postal service or the company wrecked the container. They offered me $5 off another product which makes me wonder, do they use this method to make you spend more money? I didn’t fall for any of it as I spent the $100 to have a professional set up four radon cans and do all the work for me. Way easier to just pay a pro for a harmful gas like this!
customer_reviews.author: JenniferL

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions to the letter and got my results back fairly quickly. I can’t speak to the accuracy since this is the first one we’ve done, but we’re very happy with the test I formation and extra help and literature (education) to help u derstanding the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jess W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but..
customer_reviews.text: ★ from Dennis OConnor on April 14, 2019 I never received results and AirChek refuses to take responsibility. Complain to Amazon, see if you can find the lab that does the work!! Worthless company, there are plenty of other options, use someone else!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Test didn't get to them in time
customer_reviews.text: I never heard back from them so went online for results, it said it took 11 days to get there so they couldn't get a reading. I don't know why regular mail would take 11 days, but I will try it again and send priority mail like they suggest. It was easy to use with clear directions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No response
customer_reviews.text: Followed directions and mailed it off. Haven't heard anything in over 2 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Varlet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fast results
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to use and the instructions are very clear. Postage for mailing to the lab is prepaid—this is for regular mail. My test arrived to the lab in 3 days and results were available online immediately.
customer_reviews.author: RcmlJ

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: It's been 2 weeks and no results have been sent. Would like my money back
customer_reviews.author: Timothy E.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these test kits. Unfortunately the lab results require me to use a radon mitigation system. However, the test kits were invaluable and lab results received the same day the mailer arrived at the lab.
customer_reviews.author: Tebo

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, results a week or two
customer_reviews.text: I hear some of these testing kits don't ever get the results back to you, but I had zero problems here. This package was easy to open, easy to mark, easy to seal, and easy to mail. My results came by email pretty quick (a week or two), and the results took seconds to read. Recommended to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Argyrios katos

customer_reviews.title: Quick service, easy to use, peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use directions, prepaid postage, and quick results. The result results appear roughly comparable to a test I paid $125 for a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskaguy

customer_reviews.title: Got results in a reasonable time
customer_reviews.text: Test was pretty simple to run. Contained pre-paid packaging. Results came back within the same week we sent it. This was the best price I could find so am a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: G. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Confusing to use
customer_reviews.text: Hate that you have to send this in, it's a whole process and confusing to use.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa Dehling

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Competitive pricing. Fast delivery. Speedy turnaround. We couldn't be happier with our experience with Airchek.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy's Mentor

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting
customer_reviews.text: Sent my kit in February 7th, it’s now March 11th And I’ve had no word about my text results!! Will post an update.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: fast service by Amazon and radon test lab.
customer_reviews.text: product worked great, ran 4 day test, results received by e-mail within 3 days of mailing test in. Have ordered more test kits for my son. Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CSW Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind...
customer_reviews.text: This kit gave us peace of mind as now we know our guest bedroom downstairs is safe.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel Mertz

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Efficient and they pay for postage to turn in the test.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Jeanne Strom

customer_reviews.title: So easy, why didn't I do this sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Follow the instructions and you will have results.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Glad we checked
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to know if we had radon, glad we checked
customer_reviews.author: bamc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Very quick results by email followed shortly thereafter by a written copy.
customer_reviews.author: AFI

customer_reviews.title: Great radon test
customer_reviews.text: This radon test had good directions and worked as described.
customer_reviews.author: Tim in OP

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete waste of money. Our test was done and mailed immediately. It still took 8 days to read, thus making the result inaccurate. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank L. Failing

customer_reviews.title: NOT VALLID IN NEW JERSEY
customer_reviews.text: You should put that in bold letters in the title. I wasted $ on this, did the test, never received results and then saw its not valid in NJ. I would like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, mailed before 4 pm and got the results via email the next day by 4 pm. That's an amazing turnaround!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Plan ahead!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for long term planning or if you sick of buying a new calender every year!
customer_reviews.author: richard shine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - quick results
customer_reviews.text: This test was easy to use and the company provided quick results by email.
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow directions. Results came in a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and straitforward
customer_reviews.text: The test is very easy to setup and use. The lab results were back with in 2 days of dropping the kit in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Worked well and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product was a great value and savings compared to alternatives
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast and was easy to use. Results came back fast
customer_reviews.author: Reliabilityman

product_meta.title: AirChek 43237-2 3 to 7 Day Charcoal Radon Test Kit
product_meta.description: A reliable radon Test Kit you can depend on. Over 4 million have been used! This radon Test Kit contains granular activated charcoal, which absorbs the radon gas entering the kit from the surrounding air. At the end of the test period (3 to 7 days), The kit is sent to the lab in the pre-paid mailer for analysis. The significance of radon exposure is based on the average exposure over time. Testing for radon is crucial to protecting you & your family from excessive radon levels. Note: unfortunately, these Test kits are not available To New Jersey residents. Environmental protection Agency (EPA) general guidelines The EPA recommends fixing a home If the radon level is 4 PCI/L or more & to contact a qualified radon-reduction contractor about lowering the radon level. Buying or selling a home - Use two short term tests at the same time & place to measure radon, then average the results together. Carefully follow all instructions provided with the radon Test Kit. Close Windows & Outside Doors 12 hours before testing & Keep Closed as much as possible during the test. Do not Test during severe storms or unusually high winds. Do not Disturb the test at any time while testing. Operate the home's heating/cooling system normally & Use only those that re-circulate interior air. Do Not use fans or devices that bring in outside air. If a radon-reduction system is in Place, Make sure the system is working. Place in a frequently used, lowest level room such as a living room, den or bedroom. Place the test at least 20 inches above the floor where it won’t be disturbed. Do not Test in high humidity locations or in a kitchen, bathroom or damp basement. Do not set Test near drafts, high heat, or exterior walls. Check the EPA website for the latest testing guidelines.
